content: <@!104006934562107392> Regarding the writing BLS in EVM code, can you self-start on this, or you need some help?

author: alita85
content: I can self start, but certainly some context / links to previous work / pseudocode would be helpful. Have you decided on the language? Heads up that I'm very busy, so this won't be fast

author: Deleted User
content: it is best to start with Yul, probably

author: Deleted User
content: it is kind of EVM assembly supported by Solidity compiler

author: alita85
content: Ah, okay. I've heard of it

author: Deleted User
content: there is definitely no pressure. But it should be understood that if the work goes well, and you are producing good stuff, you should get paid for it

author: Deleted User
content: so please keep us posted and let us know if you get stuck

author: Deleted User
content: you can start with Solidity itself, of course, but you will probably find very quickly that you need to drop down to the lower level, which is Yul/assembly

author: alita85
content: I mean you mentioned another language Huff I believe

author: alita85
content: And Solidity isn't very well written for optimization (at least if the assembly output is to be believed)

author: alita85
content: I picked a good time, then! Are we sure that the math is optimal?

author: s1na
content:
You can find Huff here: https://github.com/AztecProtocol/huff
And a good example (for this purpose) written in Huff is weierstrudel: https://github.com/AztecProtocol/weierstrudel which is EC arithmetic for the BN curve

author: alita85
content: Ah, Huff seems ideal

author: s1na
content:
It'll have to be patched to include the evm384 opcodes. Also one version of the opcode implementations is here: https://github.com/ethereum/evmone/tree/v0.5.0-evm384-v2
but the interface might change and your feedback could definitely feed into the design
